content: Introducing the newest member of the Australian Backdrop community: Leah Anderson :blush:
@BWPanda - Congratulations to you and your entire family!!!!!!

Introducing the newest member of the Australian Backdrop community: Leah Anderson

Now there will be two people at the meetings! ;-)
Wishes for a wonderful life on this earth for Leah :heart:

Now there will be two people at the meetings! ;-)

Yeah, now I won't just be talking to myself :laughing:

I bet that the issue queue will be a lot quieter for the next week.

;-)
:grinning_face_with_smiling_eyes:
I don't know what you are talking about @StPaulTim ...yeah, of course there'll be a couple of days of onboarding, but she'll be able to contribute soon: image.png
@BWPanda - How is the little one doing? How are you doing?

Leah's doing well. Had checkup at hospital yesterday, and a midwife will be making a house call tomorrow. I'm not that great - have had a cold for the last few days. So that plus less sleep/rest is making me feel a bit yuck. But have 2 weeks paid parental leave from the government, so hopefully will have time to settle into new routines, etc.
Glad that Leah's doing well and hope that you feel better soon. Hopefully, your getting a little sleep right now.

I'm curious about parental leave there. Here in Canada the government funds a year of leave which can be stretched to 18 months. And either parent can use all or part of it. My wife is currently in her eighth month of leave. Our daughter is 8 months already

Wow, Canada sounds like a nice place to have kids :grinning: I'm getting "Dad & Partner Pay", which is less than what my wife would get if she was working and took time off. Mine's just like a little bonus.
It's pretty nice. It's fairly recent change.
